summary: Phoebe Curtis Orr was a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll certification reports for the committee, specifically for the periods of February 1977, November 1977, and December 1977. These documents list her name and salary, indicating she was employed by the committee during that time. The documents do not provide specific details about her role or responsibilities within the HSCA.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Phoebe Curtis Orr's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her contribution are not detailed in the provided documents.
